result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:55 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Scott S. Schlough appeared by video for Andrew Elias Grinder. Defendant Andrew Elias Grinder appeared by video. Court reviews case. ADA Rockow states all discovery has been provided. Atty Schlough states reviewed discovery but has not discussed. Atty Schlough states does not foresee any motions to be filed and requests additional time to review and discuss options with DE and Atty Ellenwood. Court sets STC. Court confirms address and phone number. Adjourned 03:09 PM

Filed by DA Office K. Winberg. arc
Status conference on July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Andrew Elias Grinder
Current: 1003 Briar Ln Apt 6, Altoona, WI 54720   (Effective: 06-20-2022)
Prior: 1003 Briar Ln, Altoona, WI 54720

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Cassandra H.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:29 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA:  Erica Ellenwood  DF ATTY: Stephanie Schmidt for today   DF:  Andrew Elias Grinder appeared from jail. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD- PFAC given. Bond argument; bond ordered. NG.  Reserve on pre-plea rights. Court sets STC to check on atty. Court may allow Zoom appearances if requested. DE updates apt # of address. Adjourned at 1:32 PM.  gll  Status conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
